page.title: 16Carnival and Fete.
page.content: {Report -"Cornwall Guardian"of 18.7.85. Old miners of the John Wesley era,who hollowed out Queens Pit,now an historic monument,would have been proud,could they have visited the annual Pit Fete on Saturday,so well preserved,grass rings neatly trimmed, all the work of committee volunteers. Introductions were by the Pit Association chairman,Mr.Ken Truscott and a bouquet was presented by little Anthea Williams. Many present recalled the Pit's earlier days,Mr.Jim Pinch remembered the 1920 Wesley anniversary,with 1,300 people attending by wagonette,pony trap,horseback and those old solid tyre charabancs in glorious sunshine for this service. Saturday's event was organised by Mrs. Christina Humpleby,who thanked Miss Julian,the Indian Queens Band and all.
